intro: Meniscium serratum, commonly known as the serrated meniscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
